info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Windham, northeastern Tolland, southwestern Worcester and southeastern Hampden Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Monson, or 13 miles east of Springfield, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Webster, Southbridge, Auburn, Oxford, Millbury, Charlton, Palmer, Stafford, Spencer, Dudley, Leicester, Thompson, Sturbridge, Sutton, Monson, Douglas, Woodstock, Hampden, Warren and Brimfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
